title.narrative: Oxfam France EU Banks CBCR report

description.narrative: Oxfam is analysing the public disclosures of 20 large EU banks about the size of their activities, profits and taxes per country worldwide. We want to show that these data are useful to identify potentially aggressive tax practices, to assess which banksare apparently paying their fair share of taxes in developing countries (and EU countries), and to ask better and more targeted questions to companies about their tax behaviour. By demonstrating that these public country-by-country data are useful and that civil society organizations are able the data in a proper way, we want to reinforce the case for extending public disclosure requirements to large multinationals in all sectors. This will help Oxfam country offices and partner organizations in developing countries to hold foreignmultinationals and their own governments to account with regard to corporate tax practices. Ultimately, this will contribute to increasing the budget available for essential public services, such as health care and education.

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam France has over 25-year experience of advocacy and campaigning to influence the public opinion; it has an active supporter base of 30,000 individuals in France. It has built a very strong reputation as a trusted organization amongst decision makers, the media and the general public, especially on issues of tax justice and the malfunctioning of the international business and finance sectors. It has experience in both working on public (Government, Parliament, Ministries, multilateral organizations, etc.) and private actors (food and beverage multinational companies and banks especially). Oxfam France plays a key role in Oxfam International's workon fighting poverty directly (through access to services, food security) but also indirectly, fighting corruption and tax avoidance, and promoting domestic resources mobilization. Oxfam France is a member of the main French platforms (e.g. Coordination Sud, Platform on Tax havens). Since 2014, Oxfam France leads the Fair Finance Guide France, working in liaison with other French NGO's (amongst others Friends of the Earth, the Fédération Internationale des Droits de l#Homme).
